entry.title: Vite report on Fri, 11 Aug 2023 00:01:17
entry.summary:
Tech:
- Launch HN: Rubbrband (YC W23) – Deformity detection for AI-generated images
- How ChatGPT and other AI tools are helping workers make more money
- Open-Source Large Autoregressive Vision-Language Models: Institutions Join Forces to Replicate DeepMind’s Flamingo Models
- Sonos’ $900 Dolby Atmos soundbar has a loud pop issue that’s taking years to fix
- Configurable typing of NPM packages. Typing may be stricter than you think

Business:
- Ingersoll Rand CIO Seeks New Ways To Drive Speed And Scale Via Tech
- Identity management platform Veza secures $15M from Capital One and ServiceNow
- The worst of the housing affordability crisis may be over, but that doesn't mean it'll get easier to buy a home soon
- Undergrad enrollment in petroleum engineering has dropped 75% over the past 10 years — even though they make 40% more than computer science grads
- Markets may be on a tear this year, but the economy is under the most pressure since 2008 and could still easily fall into recession, research firm says

AI:
- How ChatGPT and other AI tools are helping workers make more money
- Launch HN: Rubbrband (YC W23) – Deformity detection for AI-generated images
- Open-Source Large Autoregressive Vision-Language Models: Institutions Join Forces to Replicate DeepMind’s Flamingo Models
- AI Is Coming For Your Data: 6 Steps To Ensure Cyber Resilience

Others:
- San Antonio punk band Piñata Protest touring with metal ... - San Antonio Current
- Exploding drone boats aren't hard to beat, but Russia's weak defenses are letting Ukraine blow up its ships
- I'm a 25-year-old with 2 master's degrees and $131,000 in student debt. I just left Paris and am getting ready to travel to Asia.
- Cher's former home on a private island in Miami is on the market for $42.5 million. Take a look inside.
- Clarence Thomas accepted previously undisclosed luxury vacations with rich friends that likely cost millions: report
- Trump's lawyers wanted Clarence Thomas to review their 2020 election lies, saying he was their 'only chance' of stopping Biden's victory
- Quinn-Finity: Welcome to Quinn-Landia Issue 1 2nd try by Nick Flair
- Exorcistic the Rock Musical Goes to New York! by Alli Chadd Emma and Michael
- FootRester™ | 3-in-1 Under Desk Foot Relief | by VILNO by VILNO

- Author Annoyed to Find Amazon Selling AI-Generated Books Under Her Name
- Neptune Nanotechnologies Raises $1.8million To Revolutionize The Materials Industry By Transforming Waste Into Nanocrystals
- This Gen Z CEO is making sure TikTok and Instagram creators get paid
- The stock market's 'no recession' relief rally is over. Expect flat markets for the rest of the year.
- High-powered satellites have made blue-carbon credits a reality. But they still face accuracy and scalability issues.
- Ukrainian special forces surprised and killed dozens of Russians in a daring nighttime river raid, reports say
- Taylor Swift is slated to give a $320 million boost to a single US county - more than WeWork's entire market value

Insights:
- In the tech category, AI-related topics are prominent, indicating the growing influence and application of AI tools in various industries.
- The business category highlights the challenges and opportunities in the housing market and the impact of technology on driving speed and scale in businesses.
- The other category covers a wide range of topics, including music, travel, personal finance, and geopolitical conflicts.
- Overall, the report showcases the diverse range of news and trends in the tech, business, and other sectors, highlighting the intersection of technology and various aspects of life.
